intro: Themistoclesia horquetensis, commonly known as the Horquetense mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as oaks and maples. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can weaken its host plants if left unchecked.
